"The Xbox Series X can allegedly play PC games thanks to “Windows Mode.” That includes playable games from Steam and Epic Games Store."

and

Xbox Series X 'Windows Mode'

As the name suggests, players will be able to boot up the console to run Windows 10 applications. The mode will effectively transform the console into a PC."

Bedrock an Java are separate for a reason. Bedrock is written in C++ code, which runs on pretty much all devices and consoles. Java is written in, well Java code. Java doesn't run on consoles so I think it pretty much just wouldn't work.
I kind of vote yes though instead of java they should put the 4j studios legacy console edition on it and update it to 1.16 and keep features like the minigames trial packs and great user interface.

I think this is a great idea.

 

Series X is a powerful console of course, it can run RTX. If it can do that, this is definitely a possibility.

Not only that, but I have a feeling this will be incredibly beneficial for the java community, since a lot of players are being abducted into bedrock. (Not that that's a bad thing)

Additionally this would open up more possibilities for the console itself, (Steam might be added)

The real question is "Is this possible?"

Overall i think this would be great as it is another reason to get the series X.

(Maybe series S will run java too?)
I would love that. All of my friends have pc's and they all play together. I've been wanting to play with them but I just have an Xbox. This would be awesome.

It is significantly more convenient to be-able to play worlds on multiple platforms that are cable, especially if, at certain times, you prefer to relax on the couch while play video games, rather than being unconformable sitting on a chair at a desk. If this feature does not get added, at the very least it would be nice for Java Minecraft to have some sort of controller support so your arms and hands do not get tired using a desktop keyboard for extended periods of time. Unfortunately, I do not see this feature being added, since Xbox's main selling point is being able to relax on the couch while playing video games.

Allow players to link all of their accounts to one Microsoft account. – Minecraft Feedback

Multiple Minecraft accounts per Microsoft account – Minecraft Feedback

This needed to be done before migration was forced

I have 4 Java minecraft accounts. I own them all. Being allowed 1 account per email is causing me so much difficulty now that I need to change my ISP because they allowed me multiple emails on one account. My new ISP (the only one that could give me FTTP) would not. So I can't get fast broadband until I sort this.
I would love Minecraft Java on ARM

> Java software isn't compiled for any specific architecture. Just get jre/jdk on your arm linux, and find old minecraft java launcher, or try for example to build multimc for arm :)

Yes, I have tried that. It's true that Java is architecture-independent, but Minecraft relies on C++ code (for OpenGL or something). The furthest I get is the old launcher, and MC won't even launch.
I think an ARM release would work wonderfully on a Raspberry Pi computer

Minecraft Java Edition (full version, not Minecraft Pi Edition) has been available for several years now on the rpi. I got it working on my rpi3 with just a few scripts provided by very friendly people on XDA forums, a simple Google search would yield that. Now the script assumes you're using an rpi, and doesn't work with my chroot Ubuntu 19.10 installation on Android. I'm going to modify the script and see if I can get it running on all ARM archs and post my results here.

Ok so I'm getting close. Tha old launcher is opening and that's the easy part that others have already done. The problem is that this launcher is using a nightly version of LWJGL 2.9.4. This is from 2015, and the nightly servers for LJGWL version 2 are down, meaning you can only get versions 2.9.3 and earlier, and of course version 3 and later on a newer website. Not only that, but LJGWL only recently (September 2019) released binaries for arm32 and arm64 on Linux, in version 3.2.3 (the newest stable build as of writing). Since LJGWL changed so much, these are completely incompatible. I honestly don't even know how the script writer got arm32 versions of 2.9.4 .so files for the rpi. I'll have to look into where the files came from (the scripts connect to Dropbox addresses) and see if I can either get arm64 versions (for newer android devices), or force Minecraft to use a newer version of LJGWL even with the old launcher.

But that'll be work for another day.
Seeing as Mac computers are converting from Intel CPUs to ARM-based SOCs, making a ARM conversion for Minecraft Java becomes even more important in order to keep the MacOS player base still alive.

Here is how to get Minecraft java version on the Pi, may help other arm deployments.

As long as you have a mojang account.

https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=78&t=284448

Please make the Unified Launcher available on the ARM architecture.

Unless there is some method of creating a new Mojang account that I have not come across, it is not possible for new users (i.e. new PURCHASERS) to enter the Minecraft world proper using the hugely popular Raspberry Pi platform since all the currently available workarounds only accept Mojang account authentication.

Since the freely available Pi edition can effectively be considered as a 'free trial', offering the option to upgrade to the full Java version surely makes sense now that the higher spec PI-4s are widely available and very capable.

I just bought a minecraft java edition subscription for my son, only because he would like to use it on a raspberry pi.

And just now, the migration to microsoft account is happening and the launcher for raspberry pi doesn't accept microsoft accounts. that's really a pity. Please help to make the java edition run again on raspi's.

@Spieler21280956 me to I have a Mojang account, but didn't have the game yet and the Mojang account was on a email account I deleted so I redeemed with Microsoft instead and can't play on pi or windows 10 s mode
Hey, the launcher available for raspberry pi doesn't accept the new, compulsory microsoft accounts.. What is going on? Please fix this, microsoft
the raspberry pi and arm sbc community needs this!

Minecraft Java works on all devices that supports Java, which is almost any device including arm devices.

However mojang is using a launcher that isn't in java + they have dropped support for their legacy java launcher.

In order for a devices with arm to run minecraft java you'll need an arm launcher or java launcher. I would try technic launcher and choose the jar version which is in java.

It's not too hard to foresee the then (2019) upcoming ARM device lineup. The game is Java, but LWJGL relies on some native binaries that for as much as I know aren't available for anything ARM64 but Linux. There's been a year and this is still hanging. How hard could It be? Is Mojancrosoft implying that Java users should be software engineers to be worthy of running the original game? Stop pushing this PiPi edition of MC and fix the masterpiece, the original Java edition really is. At least come up with an official statement and say that you don't care for the original game anymore and want our money the PE is asking for everything with all the microtransactions.

I can't agree with this. If Minecraft was put on the Steam store, then Mojang/Microsoft would lose money, since Steam takes a sizable portion of the profit games make on their store. You can just launch Minecraft through the Minecraft launcher, or if you wish, you can launch Minecraft through Steam via "Add a Non-Steam Game."
I do kinda like this idea, mainly because this could potentially open up the game to a larger fanbase. And could help with how dumb it is these days to make a proper server for cross region play
Just add it to Steam as a Non-Steam Product

Pros: Opening to a larger fan base, Steam Workshop Modding API, potentially easier server setup, in-game community interaction, playtime tracking, friends list, potential trading cards, Steam achievements alongside in-game ones/advancements,...

Cons: Valve claiming portion of the sales/profits (not like Amazon, iTunes and Google Play don't do the same...), removal/editing of "Not on Steam!" splash.

I say Microsoft should go for it, with all the benefits to the community and whatnot. :)
nah
But why does this need to be a thing? What's wrong with the launcher that we already have?
I'd rather not, as it would yeet quite a bit of profit from mojang and might encourage them to add dlc like they did with bedrock. I think it's fine as is...
It would also get cloud saves

There should be a version of Minecraft available on Steam, but not the Java Edition, I would much rather have them port the Bedrock Edition to Steam since then they could release it on Mac and Linux.

I'd also be down if they ported the Legacy Console Edition to Steam so that way we could look back on what Minecraft used to be.

is good idea why in argentina

because it is better to hack it than to buy it on the official website because the blue dollar costs a lot

I doubt they would put it on steam, mainly because the game is popular and successful enough that putting it on steam will only make them less money because Valve gets a portion of the money a game makes, so it would be losing money to put it on steam. Secondly, if they were going to put Minecraft on steam, which version would they pick. While Java edition is the primary version for most players on PC, Bedrock edition is Officially the primary version of the game and is the most played version. That's probably why Minecraft is on Game pass for Xbox but not for PC.

I'd love to see Minecraft on Steam too. It would get a bunch of new Minecrafters.

I'm pretty sure a lot of titles by Xbox Game Studios are on Steam so I doubt Minecraft should be any different.
The version that i mean that this in steam is the java edition.

Just adding my two cents regarding everyone stating profits. That isn't really a very specific issue, as you can download the launcher for free and it requires an account to log in. Odds are they would release it as a free title and all that would be required is to add the requested Steam integrations or detection for features such as achievements, cards, etc.

This should still give access to the Workshop APIs and the Steam "launcher" could simply register a custom profile to the game once it is downloaded into the Steam apps directory with the customizable profile handling any workshop content or modding APIs (Forge, Fabric, etc.) without having to manually configure and install them.

Why

Responding to ThinRocket48981:

As I said above, capes are appreciated and valued for their rarity. If everyone gets the same cape, they won't feel as special as other capes. By giving people different cape colors based on when they started playing Minecraft, it gives people the opportunity to differentiate themselves and take pride in how long they have played the game.
maybe each update should give you a cape I think it should start at 1.9 and if you were in the release of that version and newer you could select capes

I like the idea and it does make a lot of sense, because otherwise everyone will have the same exact cape and it no longer feels special. This happened with bedrock edition when releasing that creator cape about a year ago, now no one uses it because everyone has it. The same thing will almost certainly happen with this one if there is no variety among different players’ capes.

I fully support this, suggested capes:

Alpha/Beta/Release 1.2/1.4/1.6/1.8/1.9/1.10 players (8 cape colors)
i fully support this

Minecraft is a game where the multiplayer is set up and hosted by the community themselves. The idea that the company gets involved in some way with private servers (those were never exempted from moderation), realms, anarchy servers, or etc. is just a bad idea. Large Servers that have most of the issues already have moderation, and private ones don't need it. And knowing that they probably won't have humans as moderators forever and eventually will automate, as has every other company and server, this spells disaster. It is such a stupid idea for such a game. And they have had so many years since Minecraft has had a multiplayer feature, and only now you decide to add a moderation system after your merged with Microsoft? It won't work. To those in Microsoft that are reading this, Minecraft isn't a social platform like Xbox Live. Universal bans might work there, but they for sure won't work here, especially without appeals. The new migration to a new account is a good idea, but this is a turn in the wrong direction.
How does Mojang think this is a good idea?
Mojang is crazy

Mojang should not be micromanaging private servers, especially realms. If a player is hacking or breaking the rules, it is up to the owner of the server or the moderators of that server (not Mojang) to take action. This would also effectively kill anarchy servers and servers which allow profanity.

I can see what they're wanting to do, but like it's already been stated before servers are completely independent of each other. At the very least, universal moderation should be limited to realms only and should apply to realms only, since that's directly hosted by Mojang. Leave server moderation to the server owners, they know their communities FAR better than anyone at Mojang would.

Honestly, if Mojang goes through with this, I'm flat out done with Minecraft and I'll be looking into developing a clone of the game.
they are slowly ruining the game

Unlike what a lot of people here think, Mojang is not trying to slowly ruin the game. Instead, they thought that something was a good idea, in which the entire community thinks not. But of course as you all know, it's technically Microsoft. And they're known for being a really, really bad company. I'm sorry, but I don't think this is going to change.
Mojang is killing their own game

I played minecraft for years, and I do not want to get ban that cost me not playing with my friends anymore, can't interact with other people from a different server, and can't buy something at the market place. Kinda weird mojang doing this moderation thing that ban a person from 1 server that lose every online multiplayer in minecraft. Servers already have moderators to ban someone off a server not every online in minecraft that punishment is too much especially as a perma ban. I'm kinda scared of playing minecraft on online because if I'm banned goodbye online forever mojang should think instead of talking something out of their butt I'm very disappointed in mojang doing this kind of act.

391667892372 As a small-time on-and-off server owner myself, it's not my job to babysit your nephew or any other kids who are still subject to protections under COPPA (which this game is technically not compliant with, I might add, so they really shouldn't be playing online at all outside of local private servers). It's not my place to tell people how to parent, but in my honest opinion his parents need to be more active in determining which servers he should be allowed on and which ones he shouldn't, rather than letting him just run rampant and making him the servers' owners' problem. Stop using electronic devices as babysitters.

^ Agreeing with the guy above. Also, How is this Fear Mongering? This is a player showing his dislike for the new system being in place. 
As he said it isn't my place to say how to parent, but if that is really an issue restrict your child and find out how to properly manage their tech and games. Minecraft isn't a babysitting game.

That's really impossible.  Betas are experimental and can be unstable, or even broken in some important ways.  Even if they are entirely stable, they have some differences that are being tested in the beta.  In servers you have to all be running the same version of the game, and a beta is a different version.

The beta has a few things changed (like adding more mobs,bugs that got ironed out, and a block) that the version 1.4.4.0 doesn't have/didn't get ironed out. I could see this being achieved if there was a toggleable setting in a world where you could enable beta features. Agreed, currently I'm using a mod with the Java version to get into VR. The performance isn't optimal, making it the only VR game that gives me motion sickness. My other alternative is buying the Oculus version and using a mod to support my controllers. Unfortunately I don't want to buy Minecraft again when I already have it for Java and the Bedrock version. Not only that, but if mod support stops or Oculus decides to block out other headsets from their stores, I now lost money on the game. Not cool or fair.

Wonderful points. SteamVR would be a wonderful addition to the game and would not require, or even justify a steam release. The exclusivity deal really makes the whole "Better together" idea kinda distorted. Not really playing together when I can only play Minecraft VR using a custom made mod for the java eddition. Really love the VR support in Bedrock from when I had Oculus, but I didn't let that effect my decision to sell it and upgrade to a completely steam vr friendly headset. 

 

The reason steam vr works so well is because it is made with the intent of giving people open access to VR no matter which headset you use. It allows developers to easily accommodate wide ranges of headset with little work to individually tune the game for each one (But as we saw with fallout 4 vr, things can be made to not work for a specific headset even in SteamVR). To see Minecraft Bedrock add SteamVR support would be a bright day in my books, and I keep checking the internet every few months to see. This is a suggestion I fully support.

Java edition's performance has dropped severely in both 1.13 and 1.14, even with the so-called "lag fixes" in 1.14.2. Servers either have to buy hardware roughly four times more powerful to run the new versions, or put up with severe lag even with just a handful of players.

For the modding community, it's not worth updating any mods (or even Forge IMO) beyond 1.12.2. The engine is just ruined in 1.13 and up. The only reason to update beyond 1.12.2 is for the new vanilla content, and that content comes at a huge cost. It's gotten so bad that it almost seems like some kind of underhanded push toward Bedrock Edition.

I agree, performance optimization is a big issue.

I would really like to be able to play my game with FPS consistently above 30. I know computer hardware is a part of it, but I have an average CPU and good RAM; my FPS should be higher than 13-20.

"unspaghetti the java code" update would really help honestly.

while yes, bedrock edition has less lag and stuff, it is honestly too different from Java for me to switch to it just because it has more FPS. many others would agree this is the case.

Maybe an entire update where not much more content is added, just optimizations to current code because fps in vanilla Minecraft has been steadily falling down the stairs with every content update... Why do I need to rely on Optifine and other performance improving mods just so I can have more than 40 fps?
optimize Minecraft Java Edition

I wholeheartedly agree with you. Mojang should focus on appreciated, game-improving QUALITY versus controversial, game-modifying QUANTITY. Making a game better isn’t by adding something here and there, it’s about focusing on one thing to make it better, like 1.13, 1.14, and 1.16.

Upcoming Updates

In this post I am going to propose ideas for future updates and achieve great progress of the game as a brand. Update 1.22 could be a less intense and reduced update and could be released at the end of 2024 - beginning of 2025, this update would be the TRADE REBALANCING UPDATE focused on updating and rebalancing villager trades and the possible implementation of new types from Mangrove, Mountain, Cherry Tree villages or even in bamboo areas with the new wood. Apart from this, some errors would be solved.

From this update until summer 2025, 1.23, the MOBS REBIRTH UPDATE, would be released, another very small update which would add some of the losing mobs from old mob votes, including their mechanics. The most important thing about this update 1.23 is that it would focus on correcting the reported bugs and rendering the game to the maximum and improving the code as much as possible.

Finally, in Minecraft live in 2025, for update 1.24 you could present an ambitious but possible project because you were working on the plan for the second year before and having improved the rendering of the game and code. the END UPDATE focused on improving the end as you see fit.

In short, in three updates you would add things that would help the popularity of the game since they are things that the community has been asking for for many years and would give them great joy.

All of these are just ideas, my intention is neither to force nor to guess the future.

Honestly, it feels like lately a lot of the changes have just been like adding an extra block, decoration, or mob variant. I think what they really need to do in the next update is make a lot of the mechanics more solid. They need to decide how they want villager trading to actually work. They also need to pay attention to late game and item farms. I think how the game works now it really interesting with the way all the item farms work, but they need to make it more intuitive, and if they continue to produce the game where players need to google how to build any given farm, they should provide official information on it. I also think they need to improve redstone and make more resources in order for new people coming in. Lastly, they need to fix the progression. Enchanting is broken, and there's almost no point to iron armor because of how easy it's become to get diamonds in mass. I think they need to really spread things out and make it a gradual grind to the top, perhaps making diamonds rarer or giving alternative reasons to use iron tools until really late game.

To summarize, I think they need to take all the current systems and format them all similarly so that it's easier for any new player to pick up. I also think they need to fix progression and make exploring less dangerous and more fundamental to the new progression. Looking back, I think they did a really good job with the smithing upgrade template, but I feel like it's not represented in the rest of the game.

The Android version isn't available on ChromeOS. Why should the iOS version be available for Macs (also why specifically M1 macs? Most people still use Intel macs). A native port of Bedrock edition to Macs (along with ripoff Linux (ChromeOS)) would be better.

Availability of the iOS/iPadOS on M1 Macs would be a shortcut, "easy-button" way to get Bedrock onto Macs since it would run natively on the ARM-based M1 processor.  It would be better to have a dedicated version, but if Mojang doesn't want to put the extra work into developing a new app, allowing M1 Macs to download the iOS/iPadOS version would get the job done.
